meanings.definition: Of or relating to abnormal sensations such as tingling or numbness
meanings.sent1: The paresthetic feeling in my hand made it hard to grip the pencil.
meanings.sent2: She described the paresthetic sensation in her leg to the doctor.
meanings.sent3: The paresthetic tingling in my foot felt like tiny ants marching.
meanings.sent4: The paresthetic numbness in her arm was like a blanket of pins and needles.
meanings.sent5: The paresthetic sensation crawled up his spine like an icy shiver.

meanings.sent1: His paresthetic fingers struggled to button up his shirt.
meanings.sent2: The patient's paresthetic symptoms were concerning to the medical team.
meanings.sent3: The paresthetic feeling in his toes made him do a funny dance.
meanings.sent4: Her paresthetic hands felt like they belonged to someone else.
meanings.sent5: The paresthetic sensation in his skin was like a secret Morse code message.

meanings.definition: Causing a tingling or prickling sensation
meanings.sent1: The paresthetic cream left a cool, tingling sensation on her skin.
meanings.sent2: The new medication had a paresthetic effect on his fingertips.
meanings.sent3: The paresthetic lotion made her feel like she had tiny electric shocks.
meanings.sent4: The paresthetic fabric of the blanket felt like a field of static.
meanings.sent5: The paresthetic touch of the feather sent shivers down her spine.
